DENVER PUBLIC SCHOOLS
ADMINISTRATION BUILDING
414 FOURTEENTH STREET
DENVER 2, COLORADO
Kenneth E. Oberholtzer, superintendent
April 22, 1954
Dr. Harry Skornia
Executive Director, National
Association of Educational Broadcasters
119 Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Dr. Skornia:
You know that the Denver Public Schools
hold the license for Channel 6, KRMA-TV, in
Denver and that we are working together with the
Council for Educational Television, Channel 6.
Now we are in need of a good director for the
station and shall appreciate (1) any recommenda¬
tions of persons which you may care to give me
and (2) any recommendations of procedures for
selecting a director.
We have not employed any personnel,
except consulting personnel, and expect to hire
the director as the first regularly employed per¬
son. He will then assist in obtaining the other
people to be employed for the station.
It is our present plan to be on the air
by no later than January 1955, with some prior
experience in closed-circuit telecasting.
Our capital costs are provided, and we
are ordering equipment soon, after several months
of study. Our community campaign for a year»s
operating funds will be conducted from May 15 to
30, 1954. So the sooner that we can locate a
well-qualified person, the better.
I shall appreciate your assistance.
Cordially yours,
Kbnneth E. Oberholtze^
